docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, June 10. -- Credit is given to Alexander W. Weddell, United States Ambassador to Argentina, for having saved the Chaco peace negotiations from collapse at a critical moment in the early hours yesterday morning.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, June 10. -- Credit is given to Alexander W. Weddell, United States Ambassador to Argentina, for having saved the Chaco peace negotiations from collapse at a critical moment in the early hours yesterday morning.

headline.main: U.S. ENVOY SAVED CHACO PEACE TALKS; Weddell Balked Recess, Forcing Paraguayan and Bolivian to Come to Terms.

docs.snippet: MARIE CURIE is not only the first woman to have an avenue named for her on Manhattan Island but one of the very few persons, male or female, to be so honored. The cross-streets in the lower part of town carry many famous names. On the lower East Side...
docs.lead_paragraph: MARIE CURIE is not only the first woman to have an avenue named for her on Manhattan Island but one of the very few persons, male or female, to be so honored. The cross-streets in the lower part of town carry many famous names. On the lower East Side the early Presidents are remembered in Jefferson, Madison, Monroe, Jackson Streets.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, June 12. -- Buglers throughout the Chaco will sound "Cease firing" at noon Friday as a signal to suspend hostilities along the 530 miles of front. It is hoped this suspension of hostilities will be the definite termination of the war...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, June 12. -- Buglers throughout the Chaco will sound "Cease firing" at noon Friday as a signal to suspend hostilities along the 530 miles of front. It is hoped this suspension of hostilities will be the definite termination of the war which Bolivia and Paraguay have been fighting for three years and which is estimated to have cost more than 100,000 lives.

headline.main: PEACE IN THE CHACO BEGINS TOMORROW; Truce Agreement Signed in Argentina Embodies Method for Permanent Solution.
